definition: the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]

sentences.english: The Chinese Valentine's Day is on July 7th on the Lunar Calendar.
sentences.chinese: 中国情人节是农历七月七日。

sentences.english: The Mid-Autumn Day is on the August 15th of the lunar calendar.
sentences.chinese: “中秋节”是在农历八月十五这一天。

sentences.english: Shangsi Festival on March 3rd lunar calendar is a traditional Chinese folk festival.
sentences.chinese: 农历三月三上巳节是中国传统的民间节日。

sentences.english: On the Chinese calendar every year has an animal'sname.
sentences.chinese: 在农历中，每年都有一个生肖。

sentences.english: Today is September ninth by lunar calendar. It's the Double Ninth Festival.
sentences.chinese: 今天是农历九月初九，是重阳节。

sentences.english: What should we do for the coming CNY?
sentences.chinese: 为即将到来的农历新年我们该做些什么？

sentences.english: First of all, may I extend my new year  greetings to all of you, because according to Chinese lunar calendar, today is the 10th day of the first month of the Year of the Tiger.
sentences.chinese: 今天是中国农历虎年正月初十，我先给大家拜个晚年。

sentences.english: For Mr. Duan, Chinese New Year is just more unwanted time off.
sentences.chinese: 对段先生来说，中国农历新年根本就是个多余的假期。

sentences.english: The lunar calendar in March twenty-three, is the county seat of the ancient traditional, huge crowds of people on the street.
sentences.chinese: 农历三月二十三，是县城传统古会，大街上人山人海。

sentences.english: Chinese New Year Eve chanting, praying for longevity, Lion dance, tea party.
sentences.chinese: 农历年除夕延生法会，舞狮，茶叙。

sentences.english: It was the fifth day of the fifth lunar month in 278 BC.
sentences.chinese: 这一天正是公元前278年农历的五月初五。

sentences.english: Worshippers burn offerings on the fifth day of the Chinese Lunar New Year at Guiyuan Buddhist Temple in Wuhan, China.
sentences.chinese: 农历新年初五武汉归元寺挤满了供香的香客，中国。

sentences.english: The 9th day of September in the lunar calendar is "the Chinese Chong Yang Festival" and a happy occasion in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 农历九月初九是“中国的重阳节”和秋天快乐的时光。

sentences.english: It's at the end of January or the beginning of February. It marks the beginning of the lunar year.
sentences.chinese: 春节在一月份或二月初，标志着农历年的开始。

sentences.english: That day was July 15 on the lunar calendar, the day of the Ghost Festival.
sentences.chinese: 当天，正巧是农历七月十五日中元节。

sentences.english: Year "Xin Zheng, " which means "the new, first month. "
sentences.chinese: 厦门人把农历新一年的正月称为“新正”。

definition: old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
first month of the lunar year
intercalary month in the lunar calendar/leap month
first month (of either lunar or Western calendars)
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
